labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to extract transcripts from public YouTube videos, allowing AI assistants and work tools (like Cursor and Claude Desktop) to analyze video content directly. This enables easier access to captioned video content for AI-driven workflows, eliminating manual transcription needs for research, content creation, or data analysis.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality revolves around extracting and processing video content from YouTube, which aligns with data extraction and AI-driven content analysis. While it could loosely fit under "Data Analysis & Processing" due to potential use in research, its core purpose is extracting transcriptsâ€”making "Content Creation" a strong secondary fit (e.g., for AI-generated summaries or notes). No custom label is needed as the predefined categories cover its role adequately.

tools.name: youtube-transcript-extractor
tools.description: Extracts the transcript of a YouTube video.

server_info_crawled.name: YouTube Transcript Extractor
server_info_crawled.author: @MalikElate/yt-description-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Extract transcripts from any public YouTube video to enable AI assistants to analyze and work with video content directly. Integrate easily with Cursor and Claude Desktop for seamless AI-driven video transcript extraction. Simplify access to YouTube captions for enhanced AI workflows.

tools.name: youtube-transcript-extractor
tools.description: Extracts the transcript of a YouTube video.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@MalikElate/yt-description-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
